page.title: 07GEOGRAPHY OF SEAMILL
page.content: {50% of Seamill}is bordered by sea and the other{50% by farmland and {hills.}All the farms are locally owned and the average size is approx. 600 acres. Those 600 acres would be split up as follows: 200 acres barley, 60 acres potatoes, 20 acres turnips and 320 acres of grassland. Sheep, calves and beef cattle would be reared and fattened on surrounding hills. The surrounding{sea is fertile, with many {types of sea life.}Shellfish, viz. cockles, mussels, lobsters, crabs and prawns,which the locals enjoy catching and eating. The waters are also fished commercially. A large chunk of land is taken up by{Hunterston Iron-ore {Terminals.}Hunterston,also the site of a{Nuclear Power Station,}is surrounded by trees and hills.Cattle graze nearby because the fields are green. It is possible to walk from Seamill to......
